result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryon C. Rochon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryon C. Rochon

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: sent to Bryon Rochon

09:23 AM Attorney Jeffrey Ocwieja in court, defendant Bryon C. Rochon not in court, in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for reconsideration filed.  Request for reconsideration on denial of 45 days to report for jail sentence.  State reviews motion.  No argument, either way, given.  Court will deny motion and gives basis.

01:15 PM Defendant Bryon C. Rochon in court with attorney Jeffrey Ocwieja.  Defendant Bryon C. Rochon in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC recommendation:  1 yr jail, concurrent to any other cases.  Atty Allen and Atty Ocwieja jointly concur in the recommendation of the DOC.  Atty Allen advises there is 178 days credit.  Further, request that jail sentence begin on 10/01/2019.  Any unpaid costs shall be converted to civil judgment.  Court will accept recommendation and sentence the defendant as requested.
sent to Bryon Rochon
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 16, 2019 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 27, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Allen present.  Jeff Ocwieja present.  Court recounts letter from defendant.  He is in custody in Dane County on a Dane County Case, and reasons given.  Allen won't charge with failing to report on 2/18/2019. He was earlier given credit for 70 days in the event he is revoked.  Discussion held.  Court gives Mr. Rochon credit for time served from 2/18/2019 until he is actually released. The jail will advise the Court when the def is released from Dane County.  The JOC is ordered amended in 18CF94, 16CF26, 27 & 28.
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Present:  ADA Allen, Atty. Ocwieja with Bryon Rochon in custody, CS Investigator Deb Rosenthal.  Court calls 16CF26; 16CF27; 16CF28 and 18CF94.  Dorothy Polkinghorn present, but she chooses not to speak.  Court questions victim contact, all victims received notice.  Court hears counsel re plea agreement.  Court advises of charges in penalties in all 4 cases - defendant understands and wishes to proceed.  In 16CF26, 16CF27 and 16CF28 - Attorney Allen moves to Dismiss and read in Count 2 - no objection by Ocwieja - Court orders Count 2 in 16CF26, 27 and 28 dismissed and read in.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties in 16CF26, 27 & 28 - Count 1 -no contest plea entered; 18CF94 - count 1 - No Contest plea entered.  State waives jury trial. Mr. Rochon sworn, court conducts plea waiver colloquy.  Court finds knowing, intelligent, free waiver of rights.  ADA Allen states that all DRI charges are subject to resitution (for child support) and it is addressed as continued payment of child support.  Court accepts the No Contest pleas and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1 in 16CF26, 16CF27 and 16CF28, and also guilty in 18CF94.  Court hears counsel - both request the court accept the joint recommendation and gives reasons.  Court hears defendant. Court enters order -  As to each case:  Sentence withheld, probation ordered for 4 years, concurrent with each case and any other cases the defendant is serving.  There is 40 days conditional jail time imposed on each case, concurrent to each other and any other sentence being served, and work release is permitted in each.  Defendant is to report ot jail within 14 days.  Credit for 70 days subject to jail verification.     Mr. Rochon may transfer his probation to Illinois or Iowa subject to approval from that state.  Mr. Rochon may serve his jail sentence in any jail in Wisconsin, or in Illinois or Iowa, subject to approval. Court Costs ordered in all 4 cases, and there is also a $20 CPS surcharge in 18CF94.   His DNA is already on file.  Conditions:  Make a good faith effort to seek work and maintain employment. Remain current on all child support, which is $811/month on the Iowa County cases, and this includes $5.00/week on arrears payment in 16CF28 which is to be ordered in Case No. 10FA113.  Follow through on any vocational training and counseling as directed by DOC.  Notify child support of any address changes, phone number changes and employer changes within 48 hour.  The $1,500 cash bond is ordered applied as follows:  $500 to 03PA17; $500 to 03PA04; and $500 to 10FA113.  Defendant understands.  Defendant remanded.
